segments.text: Excuse me .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yeah ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I've never used this place before.Can you give me some idea what I need to do ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You just put quarters in the machines.It ' s easy .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , but ... well ...
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: What ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: How do I use the machines ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: What do you mean ? These are the washing machines . Those big things over there are the dryers .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I see . Do the machines have soap in them ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No , of course not . You have to put soap in . Did you bring your soap ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: No . I don't have soap .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , you can buy some from that vending machine over there .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Thanks.Okay . I have my soap .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: My God ! You really bought a lot . Why do you need so much ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I don't know . I want my clothes to be clean .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: But you can't use so much.The machine won't be able to rinse the soap out .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh . I guess I didn't know . I have never washed clothes before .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: What ? Did you say you never washed clothes before ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: In your life ? Are you kidding ? Never ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: No . Never .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I can't believe it . How can that be ? How old are you ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I'm nineteen .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: But how can you live nineteen years without ever washing clothes ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: My mother always did it .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , my mother washed my clothes too.But when I was twelve , I started to wash clothes myself .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I know about this fact.American children are more independent . They do more for themselves.But I am from Taiwan . In Taiwan , children must study very hard.So the mother does everything for the kids.The mother wants her kids to get very good grades at school.So I've never washed clothes before . You shouldn't laugh at me for it .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I'm not laughing at you . But let me ask you something ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: What ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: How are you going to survive here ? I mean , if you can't do anything for yourself.If you can't cook , if you can't wash clothes , if you can't clean house.How can you live on your own ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I don't know . It's hard . But I have to learn .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , I'll help you learn how to use these machines .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Thanks . My name's Nick .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I'm Alice . I guess I'll have to be your mother for today .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Thanks , Mom . Thanks .
segments.speaker: S1
